items.message: This flood alert has been issued as heavy rain and thunderstorms have been forecast for this area this evening (25/06/2021). There is uncertainty over the amount of rainfall expected and the exact location of the heavy rain. River and surface water flooding may affect these areas. We urge you to remain vigilant and avoid walking and driving through flood water. We are continuing to actively monitor the situation closely and will issue updates, and further flood alerts and warnings if necessary. You can monitor your local weather conditions and river levels on the GOV.UK website.

items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
River levels are expected to be high as a result of spring tides.

The forecast high tide at Richmond will be 4.65mAOD at 04:30 on 26/06/21.

Flooding of low-lying roads and footpaths is expected, which may exist for one to two hours either side of high tide. Flooding of properties is not expected.

We believe there is a possibility of flooding for Putney Embankment (SW15), Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green (W4), Thames Bank at Mortlake (SW14), Ranelagh Drive (TW1), Friars Lane and Water Lane (TW9), Riverside and The Embankment at Twickenham, and the Towpath below Teddington Lock. 

Astronomical tide levels are rising. The river flow at Teddington Weir is low for this time of year at 50 cubic metres per second and is steady. We anticipate the flows to remain low for the next few days.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

This message will be updated by 11:00 on 26/06/21, or as the situation changes.

Sea levels will be high along this coastline as a result of spring tides. Forecast high water is at 20:15 on Friday 25/06/2021 with a level of 6.34 mAOD and a Force 5 Westerly wind. All times are local and refer to the high water time at Hinkley Point. mAOD is height above average sea level. For more detail refer to local tide tables. Flooding to low lying coastal roads and farmland is possible along the coastline between Gore Point and Hurlstone Point including Porlock Weir. Flooding of properties is not currently expected. Spring tide conditions are expected to continue through the weekend but are not currently forecast to reach further Flood Alerts after this evening's (Friday) tide. We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are checking defences. Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads, and consider alternative routes. This message will be updated tomorrow, Saturday, 26/06/2021 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Stour and Smestow Brook in the Black Country and South Staffordshire
items.message:
River levels have risen at the Stourbridge river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible between later this evening, Friday 25/06/2021.     
  We expect river levels to begin falling tomorrow morning on Saturday 26/06/2021.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 26/06/2021, or as the situation changes.

River levels have risen at the Selly Park river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected this evening.  Flooding is affecting low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Rea between Longbridge and Nechells including Northfield, Kings Norton, Lifford, Stirchley, Selly Park and Digbeth.   
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 3 hours. 
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 26/06/2021, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Kennet and its tributaries from Berwick Bassett down to Newbury

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Kennet, River Og, River Aldbourne, Froxfield Stream, River Dun, River Shalbourne

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels are fluctuating on the River Kennet but are generally stable and should begin to fall again soon. Therefore, the risk of flooding is reducing. 
Isolated heavy rain and thundery showers are forecast for today and over the weekend. We expect river levels to begin falling again this afternoon 25/06/2021.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area checking defences. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow 26/06/2021, or as the situation changes.
